reviewText:
Final Fantasy Type 0, a game of the Fabula Novala Crystalisis is finally on the PC. While it fixed a lot of the graphical lag, the game is still almsot entirely a medicore mess. I would warn anyone to caution getting this unless you are not just a dire hard Fianl Fantasy fan but also a very engaged fan of the Crystalsis storyline. The game has nothing to do with the 13 storyline, but uses the same Mythos and Universe. That being said, if you know how FFXIII plays out then you're quite able to figure out how Type 0 must end. In addition to this, the game is overrun with poorly designed characters. The game has you cotrolling an entire team of 13 soilders, and the character development is all over the place it's real easy to loose who is doing what when were and why.

The story does have a few merits, though. Amazing cutscenes and story presentation make the game almost enticing for that and that alone. You feel truly invested in what happens & that your mission(s) actually save the world.

Sadly, this does not recover it fromt he plethora of problems noted above coupled with the pretty horrible voice acting/character idle movements. A saving grace would be the gameplay, except that it is also beyond saving. You can easily complete the game changing weapons/acessories twice, and rarely to never powering up magic/summons. This makes obtaining Armor/Weapons/Summons mostly pointless, unless you want to go into NG+. Suppose NG+ is the selling pont of the game, should it take you till level 40 to need to upgrade weapons? I think not.

In the end, if you love the mythos, play it, if you hated FFXIII's lore steer clear away from this hot mess of a game. If you've been dying to play this but don't own a PSP, then maybe this is for you. Just know you're getting into a game that can be 100%'d in less than twenty hours with no real effort.

reviewText:
-Only 2 resolution options.
-Bad control scheme for keyboard and mouse.
-30FPS cap bound to game logic.
-Drops below 30 frequently.
-Only supports a 360 controller.

Unless you're a hardcore FF fan do not buy this game. It's a mediocre port and not worth your money.
Wait for them to fix these issues, if they don't (which they probably won't) ignore this game.
Another example of a great game ruined by the port thanks Squeenix.

reviewText:
I thought i just make this review, cause i think the game is totally underrated for completely ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t resaons, seriously...

1. Reason is...you can't play it properly with  keyboard and mouse. What the ♥♥♥♥ are you serious ? This game was a previous psp title, its not made for keyboard and mouse, it wasn't even made for 2 controlsticks, and despite that fact, there are so many other games that pretty much require a controller to play it properly, for example dark souls, wich btw is a very popular game that is liked by many people even though you have to play it with a ♥♥♥♥ing controller.

2. Reason is...the camera sucks. Sure the camera is a bit weird, but you also have to consider that it was a psp game. It is a camera that was based on a handheld console, deal with it. In my opinion you just have to get used to it, i've been playing this game for a while now and im feeling quiet confortable since then, more than on the psp actually. i played the japanese psp version and i know the difference, they fixed many many stuff, including the camera, i know the camera is not the best, but its still better than on the psp, also the controls in general (it feels a lot smoother, 30fps lock is really no big deal, i don't have the best gpu, but i never had any lag at all. As long as it stays 30 fps you're good to go)

At the end of the day, its really sad to read such things from the final fantasy community. I think Square Enix remade this game, to make a worldwide release, so everybody can play it, therefore giving them such a bad feedback is kinda disrespectful...): You guys should be happy for beeing able to play it in your language, i mean, when you dont like it, because you dont have this familiar final fantasy" experience or because you dont like the story

reviewText: wow. I mean I know this is a ported game from a ported game... but even in the first hour of play there were so many technical issues: audio not working / not synced, camera movement inconsistency, input lag, animations clipping or not even running properly, or the camera going inside of the Boss in the first summon fight, and texture quality is all over the place. not to mention there are only TWO options for resolution....\n\nI see what Square wanted to do with this game, it wants to be a hack and slash with the kind of strategic thinking that final fantasy games are known for. And if I played this on the PSP, that probably would have been what I got. I really dont think this is on Square Enix unless they have a team internally that handles ports (I dont think most game companies do this?) but I am not even going to bother playing this game again unless someday I get a steam notification saying a patch is ready for download.

reviewText:
White screen on start-up.... tried running in administrative mode and from admin CMD that were both tested in window mode or full screen selects. verified game installation to be working correctly, checked regional clocks for decimal setting being . instead of ' or , keys. Tried both resolution settings and have all drivers up to date. Tried numerous locale changes, I am running a 64 bit windows 7, and Direct X was reinstalled twice to confirm it was working correctly.

In short, I highly recommend you DO NOT purchase this game. No game should have this many issues with at least getting past the launch menu. O_O Please do consider taking my advice by RUNNING FAR AWAY from this game and sparing yourself the frustration that is this poorly done port for FFT0 Steam.

My last bit of advice is that for any of you having similar issues is to quickly request steam to issue a refund for your purchase. Especially... if you made this game a pre-order request like myself. I truly wanted to have high hopes for this game, it to me showed an inkling of the old Final Fantasy industry and demonstrated potential that SE was trying to find renewed inspirations from it's past achievements. But sadly, in typical SE fashion, they continue to prove just how poor their services are rendered and just how very transparent they are these days.

All that I have left that I feel needs to be expressed is shame on you SquareEnix, you do a grave disservice to your talented predecessors and visionaries of old from the late 90's. It truly is a shame we lost Monolith soft to Nintendo and are now left with an empty shell of what used to be two very good game companies, ones that used to somewhat demonstrate a much needed competency for both it's consumer base and it's service. I really think it is fair to say this will be my last game purchase from SE and I will exclusively support their new found interests in producing Anime titles henceforth because frankly speaking their anime titles are of much better quality than most of their recent games for the past decade and a half.

P.S. I may live in Japan, but I lost all desire on ever wanting a tour of the SquareEnix facility, I realized the artistic souls that were the companies Enix and Square are no more.

reviewText:
final fantasy type 0. the long awaited psp game that finally have shipped out of japan to other countries.

is this the game for you??? then answer these questions to yourself:

> are you a final fantasy fan?
> do you like jrpgs?
> can you be forgiving that there are some bugs that will take while to be fixed?
> do you have time to invest in a certain game?
> do you like tough challenges?

if all of the above are yes. then its the game for you
if there is even a single no. then you might reconsider it.

here are the things what i do and don't like about the game:

pros:
+ support characters can be helpful when you are in bind
+ great music
+ controlls are smooth (used the ps3 controller)
+ variety in characters and preferred playstyle
+ can be challenging
+ japanese audio
+ some side quests can keep you busy in a good way and prepare you for the next mission.

cons:

- to much grinding: leveling can be fun. but if its a chore its not.
- support characters wont reach when you have to take a flying ranged enemy and there is no way to reach them.
- expert trial are way to high and consumes to much time.
- training mode is to repetitive and unrewarding. there are better areas to grind.
- tasks are vague with the rewards you get and you have to take a risk to give items in return for less unwanting/usefull.
- some enemies are just plain unfair and give you the sense you can beat them in missions.
- english texts doesnt align the personallity with the japanese audio
- some technical difficulties.

beside the bugs and technical issues, the game is ok. i don't really like but maybe someone else or even you can like it. some of my cons can be your pros.

reviewText:
Another great addition to the Final Fantasy franchise. This little surprise first came out on phones and the PSP before getting ported to consoles and then here. The combat system feels really crisp and refreshing compared to other FF games. A decent story with predicatable but still interesting twists help make this one of my favorite Final Fantasy games of all time.

You do not want to play this game with a Mouse and Keyboard. It does not function well although it still works if you are really desperate. I can't tell the difference between 30 and 60 fps so I can't rly give much opinion on that 30 FPS lock that SE tends to do for their PC ports. Aside from that the game runs perfectly on a GTX 770 and I5-4690k with no crashes in both windowded and fullscreen mode. Visuals are slightly improved from the PS4 version if you have everything maxed.

I HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone looking for a top notch final fantasy game.

reviewText:
Don't waste your money on this. Seriously. This is one hell of a bad port. The graphics are even worse as seen on the screenshots. Now don't get me wrong, graphics are not everything, but this one looks flat out atrocious with muddy textures, no detail level and bad to none lip sync. It makes you wanna throw up, believe me.
What's more, the gameplay feels stiff and wooden, you're wondering, if your controller is broken (yes, even when using an xbox-controller). The dialog scenes are drawn out with little to no interesting revelations, no autosave feature and there's that ESC-key ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t again like in XIII and XIII-2.
You could definitely say I'm a FF-fanboy. I played 4,5,6,7,8,9,10,10-2... I also LOVE the Lightning-trilogy, which many people thought had serious flaws. I devoured those games. But Type-0 is really the first Final Fantasy game ever I've been truly disappointed about right from the very beginning.
At least I got a quick refund. Steam seems to be aware it sucks.

reviewText:
So, I'm a huge RPG fan and Final Fantasy VII was one of my earliest ones. I played the original Final Fantasy type-0 on the PSP and, you know what, I loved it.

The game stood apart from other Final Fantasy games significantly in story and scope without completely abandoning the style. The story was interesting and didn't baby you. The characters were varied and the writers understood that having many primary characters meant not being able to touch on many others outside of that cast. The gameplay was solid, though I do wish there were more strategy segments as that was so, so, so much fun. The parallels to WWII were attractive. This was my favorite Final Fantasy since Crisis Core and gave me resounding hope for Fabula Nova Chrystallis.

With that being said, don't buy this port. It's slow, clunky and lags far too much to be worth your money. Go borrow a PSP and get the original version then download an English patch for it. It should still be available on the Japanese PSN store. Despite the beautiful graphics and wonderful story, the game is nearly unplayable with the speed it runs with. This was acceptable on a smaller system, but not here.
voteText: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
When I found out about this game, I was definitely intrigued. A Final Fantasy game with action RPG combat, a large and diverse cast of characters and a much grittier story than the typical plot from the rest of the series.
Ultimately, I do not recommend the game. Here are my pros and cons:

Pros:
1. The combat system has some good depth to it.
2. The characters all feel very different, I took time to play as each one before quitting the game. All have different personalities in addition to different weapon types and playstyles.
3. Grinding, for those interested, is made easy with the repeated encounters mechanic. You no longer have to run around in circles to grind levels. You simply hit a button to fight again.

Cons:
1. Performance on PC is terrible. Sub 30fps regularly even when you're out of combat.
2. Input lag exists far beyond your typical 30fps experience. When the framerate is at its worst, a full second can pass between a button press and the execution of a basic attack. This results in occassionally frustrating combat.
3. Combat systems are nicely done, but very poorly explained for non-regulars.
4. Voice acting, even for a Final Fantasy game, is absolutely horrific. Every character sounds completely uninterested in the plot.
5. Sound in the cutscenes is completely out of sync. Sometimes sounds would happen almost a full second or two before the action happens on screen. Characters can have closed mouths and still be yelling due to the audio sync delay.
6. Texture work is actually WORSE on PC than it is on PS4. Every game I have ever played on my current system looks far better on my system than it did on PS4. When I saw my friends play this game on PS4 I was even more upset with this port.
7. The story is lackluster. I may have a blunted opinion of this because of how much the audio sync issue broke my since of immersion in the first cutscenes, but I am completely uninterested in the story other than the back story about the 4 kingdoms.


Summary: This game has a fun combat system and a great cast of characters muddled beneath a lackluster story, terrible visuals and horrible input lag. It also has TERRIBLE audio sync issues that completely ruined my experience with the opening cutscenes. Even with a controller (which is apparently preferred), I can't recommend this game to anyone. Even RPG fans or fellow Final Fantasy players like me.

reviewText:
Final fantasy type-0 is good game that I recommend for people who liked final fantasy 13 on steam. I enjoy playing rpg/fantasy style as well as other FF games and I am enjoying playing this game thus far.

Few keypoints to take note:

1. Battle system is a bit more hack/slash oriented (not turn-based).

2. Keyboard controls for camera is very difficult->mouse camera is very difficult to use. You should use a controller, I am using a xbox-360 controller for PC. This makes the controlls super easy.

3. Graphics are for PSP->PC. It is acceptable, for the price i paid for pc redone-> It is fine.

Overall I recommend this game if you like FF games or fantasy/rpg games. I Highly recommend using controller for controls (keyboard alone is very difficult to control camera).


For controller I use xbox 360 controller for PC (bought of amazon)

reviewText:
This game plays fine on my A-10 AMD APU and my biggest issues are the video and audio stutters.

Storyline looks awesome reminds me of Fushi Yuugi. Vermillion is Suzaku and such. The Chocobo in the beginning CGI is even named Chichiri. <3

The Fushigi remnants I see just make the game all the more sad. People and animals do die in this game. They don't come back either. There is blood and there are brutally gorey scenes. Be prepared for feels.

Graphics are kinda iffy at times, most things look fine, but in some areas you can tell the textures weren't upgraded to suit the HD Scale.

The camera acts a bit wonky, especially with the lock-on features. I will be trying different camera settings in the launcher to see if this can be stopped. the split second change in angles kind of make it tough to see what is going on.

Overall I like it and will need to power through the sad parts. Plays just like Black Rock Shooter on the PSP. (Another JRPG)

reviewText: I was so excited to see this game coming out in the US having played the PSP version of the game several times. My first impressions were ok but I was expecting much more that what was povided. For starters it almost feels as if the movie bits were all kept virtually the same. They might have been touched up but thats not the biggest issue. When it comes to in game graphics they look pretty solid and im running it on the best settings possible currently. But being an HD release of this game certain things bug me, the outer areas still look horribly pixilated and lots of NPCs sit or stand like statues. Would it have been so hard to make them look more human in their movements? Now im not asking for super amazing graphics its just if im gonna pay money for this remake at least go all out even if it cost a few more bucks im more than willing to dish out the cash for it. Gameplay is solid and i havent run into any bugs or glitches, overall the game is still great just expected more change. Rate `10/10 for gameplay 7.5/10 for visuals and the english voice acting is good for some characters, others not so much...I wish i could pick who was in english and who was in jap

reviewText:
Another great addition to the Final Fantasy franchise. This little surprise first came out on phones and the PSP before getting ported to consoles and then here. The combat system feels really crisp and refreshing compared to other FF games. A decent story with predicatable but still interesting twists help make this one of my favorite Final Fantasy games of all time.

You do not want to play this game with a Mouse and Keyboard. It does not function well although it still works if you are really desperate. I can't tell the difference between 30 and 60 fps so I can't rly give much opinion on that 30 FPS lock that SE tends to do for their PC ports. Aside from that the game runs perfectly on a GTX 770 and I5-4690k with no crashes in both windowded and fullscreen mode. Visuals are slightly improved from the PS4 version if you have everything maxed.

I HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone looking for a top notch final fantasy game.

reviewText:
I can sum up Final Fantasy Type-0 with one word: grindy. The story quickly out paces your level, forcing you to grind to catch up (thankfully there's an easy xp exploit to solve that problem). There are side-quests littered throughout the game but they boil down to simple fetch or kill quests. Even the main quests lack excitement as you simply work your way from point A to point B, killing everything in between. That is somewhat alleviated by the combat which I thoroughly enjoyed. The action RPG-style combat combined with 14 playable characters, each with their own different play style, was a blast.

+ Combat is really fun.
+ The eidolon's are neat, especially watching them in the cut scenes.
+ The story was decent enough.

- So very much grinding.
- Too many times where you get one-hit killed.
- I found the game generally lacking in excitement.

Playtime: ~ 27h
6/10

reviewText:
Pros:
-Real-time battle system is a refreshing departure from the typical FF systems
-Cutscenes look pretty damn good for originally being a PSP game
-The 30fps lock is surprisingly not that noticeable due to motion blur
-Some of the textures/models look great
-Story seems interesting
-Japanese voice cast is all-star-eargasm material; if you're an anime watcher you'll be very impressed with who they brought on for this game.
-It's the best FF port Square Enix has released yet.

Cons:
-The battle camera, though better than what I've seen on the PSP/PS4/xbOne, still has its derpy moments, especially fighting enemies above you.
-Levels are tiny. There are a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of loading screens. Like, a ridiculous amount. Damn you PSP.
-If you don't like motion blur, you're really going to notice the lack of frames.
-Some of the textures/models look horrific
-Though the story is interesting, I really have no idea what's going on yet. Based on what I've read about the game I'll never know.
-If you're not a weeb and want to play using English, you'll probably like the cast; if you are  a weeb, you won't. As expected.
-Though it's SE's best FF port, it's still pretty ♥♥♥♥.

Overall: If you bought this game expecting a horrific PSP port you'll be pleasantly surprised, and given the interesting gameplay and story you'll likely enjoy it a lot. If you're a snob who expected to flame the hell out of this game and regret your purchase if it's a bad port, you won't like it and should have expected it to be bad, so don't play it. While I see most FF fans loving this game (and the fact that it's a considerably better port than other FF's), if you're not a fan of FF and thinking about trying something new, this one's probably not for you.

All that said, I'm a weeb who likes FF games. So thumbs up for me.

reviewText: Square Enix. Oh, Square Enix. Why do I keep giving you my money? I love a lot of your games and I get excited whenever you port your console games to PC because I think I am going to get a great experience, but everytime I pre-order a game you port over I get let down. Whether it's inconsistent framerates, limited or low graphics options, or certain features not functional, us PC users get a lesser experience. I am a big believer of vote with your dollars and I have consistently voted in support of you porting Japanese RPGs to PC, especially Final Fantasy games, but I cannot and will not pre-order your PC games anymore, Square (if I order them anymore). I have bought Final Fantasy XIII, Final Fantasy XIII-2 and now this game, even though I already owned the console versions of these games. Out of all the aforementioned games, this is the worst port I have seen not only from Square Enix, but from a developer period (to include Dark Souls Prepare to Die Edition). Where do I start? Poor performance for Nvidia hardware, internal resolution stuck at 720p even when I select 1080p in the launcher, no proper SLI support and worse performance or graphics bugs when forcing SLI, locked FPS, only 720p or 1080p resolution options, and poor overall in-game appearance (game looks worse than PS4 version). This is just the beginning of the laundry-list of issues I have had with this game just in the first hour of playing. It wouldn't be so bad if I had faith that Square Enix would resolve these issues, but with the way they treated the Final Fantasy XIII port I doubt it. The upside? They kept true to their promise and fixed the in-game camera so now I don't feel like I am getting motion sickness in battle from the camera action, but the rest of the game just looks and plays so poorly it doesn't really matter because it's nigh unplayable. As far as the game itself, it's an enjoyable action RPG that has a pretty legit and mature story. Story and game time is progressed through completion of game quests. I would say gameplay wise, the biggest detractor is that there are 14 (yes, 14) playable characters that you have to figure out how to manage resources and upgrades. You basically have to figure out strategies and which players to use, which will lead to which characters you level up. Honestly, though, with how poorly this version plays, if you have a choice between playing this on console and PC, I would have to say the PS4 version is honestly the superior version. Square you have fooled me at least twice, but I doubt you will fool me again and I will definitely not pre-order your PC ports anymore. I guess I will just have to purchase the games I want to play on PS4, but I won't be throwing my money at you anymore. The worst part? I pre-ordered the game through Green Man Gaming at a great price. So while I saved money on the purchase, it wasn't purchased through Steam directly and now I can't get a Steam refund.

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game, I really do.

I had a tough time trying to write this review down as I have alot of nagging issues with this game. Firstly, framerate. Where is the 60FPS option? Also, the option in the graphics settings are just shallow and not well detailed. This game should have more options for us to tinker with, which is a pity in my opinion.

Secondly, the camera is just off. I don't have a controller (and I believe is the ONLY way of playing this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥). At least they have remapping available but it's dissappointing to see that the default buttons make it awkward and cumbersome to play.

Thirdly, the general sub-par performance in the VA. I just wanted to wallow in shame from the english translation. I just set to japanese instead. Why won't Square improve on this? I just don't understand why can't they find good VAs for the english translation?

Last one isn't really much a point but I just want to vent it out. The save system to me seems a bit broken. The pacing and sequences of autosaving to me seems off and should be implemented better if compared to other similar games such as this.

Again, this game could have been better but given it was a PSP port, it's kind of hard to expect alot of changes. I just wished they did

reviewText:
TL;DR : The game is fine, If you're worried about the mixed reviews get when its on sale.
And if you bought it and don't like it get a refund, that's why its there.

Now comes my personal Review:

Controller set up works fine. No problem.
If you are having problems I recommend reading forums and googling for further details and fixes.

Terrain Texture is par But the characters are good (Tbh I'm impressed what they did with it since it was a psp release, the one before vita!).

There are an absurd amount of people complaining about texture quality. This game was realised on PS4 and Xbox one in March, its the same Texture. Before buying and complaining about it. Do some research before buying and keep in mind that this was originally a psp game. Youtube some gameplays to see if you are okay with the quality of the game.

Now to my final point. This game IS LOCKED at 30 fps, which I am okay with. At least it doesn't drop randomly. Smoothness > Absurd amounts just because I can, and again I will state again this was a HD port of a psp game, which is understandable why there's a lock in the first place.

I recommend that if you are one of those people who care about framerates, follow a Steam Curator called The Framerate Police. they're there to tell you about framerates.

I'll edit this with final thoughts of the game once I've actually put in some time to play it.

reviewText:
Just more complete garbage. In what has become Square's typically 'out of touch' motif of gaming lately. This is another entry that made us hopeful and then dashed that hope with a pinch of despair.

When I read about this game it seemed like a potential throwback to the classic days of FF VI, VII, VIII, IX, X - which we all dearly miss. Instead it's a hyper accelerated ridiculous mobile game.

The graphics go from slightly impressive to dismally dull very quickly. The intro is about 30 minutes of gut-wrenching sorrow, with NO interaction whatsoever. Followed by incredibly convoluted combat with no support for gamepad instructions (keyboard keys are presented instead, which don't help at all).

The pace is frenetic and the combat repetitive, the story is as convoluted and confusing as anything I've seen from Square lately. Just another example of the rapid sliding downhill mess that Squeenix has become. The mighty have officially fallen and none of these mobile re-hashes are going to help bring it back.

I'm waiting to see some reviews of FF XV to see if 'maybe' they've gotten their head out of their asses, but this is just another in the long line of utter failures to eek their way out of the shady money-obsessed den that that is SE. Please stop it Square, just stop. Re think your whole strategy. Go back to what worked, listen to your fans.

reviewText:
I normally don`t write reviews as my opinion is generally minority and unfortunately money always wins, but in this case I just have to. I love the final fantasy series and have always found their stories beautiful and captivating (apart from FF8 maybe, which was also partially war based). The game was what it`s supposed to be for me: a game (as in a thing to pass time and have fun as opposed to a second job/challenge you need to fulfill).

I don`t have a million arguments to specify all that this game does well or not, because I just could not play very far into it. The reason being that unfortunately this new type of FF has ruined my most treasured reasons why FF was unique and fun to me:

1) It was turned into yet another war game where I can`t even tell where the enemy is most of the time. Action and reflexes over thinking. We are definitely running out of good games that aren`t just killing crap the exact same way through the whole thing...
2) Excessive camera turning which makes me sick (yes, I get motion sickness from playing games so FF was actually a game I COULD play for more than an hour at a time).
3) It used to have a lighter, more spirited and funny air to it even when holding sad events and now right at the intro it`s just blood and death everywhere like all other shooters out there.
4) Controls are now more individualistic rather than an actual team play (and btw they just don`t respond properly, so fun turns into frustration very quickly). I miss the games where you didn`t have to be a one man unbeatable machine and you could see where each character`s strengths and weaknesses were and apply them properly to succeed.
5) Despite the presence of the eidolons, magic and the futuristic look it no longer feels like fantasy"
recommended: because it has gotten too close to reality (a thing a lot of games these days seem to be striving for). Sometimes you just need something NOT real to help relax from the daily crap. I miss the days where you could just do crazy
voteText: impossible things as in the Lucas Arts age.\n\nAnyway
helpfulPercent: I know most people would disagree
votesHelpful: but this is only my opinion. And through my perspective I would not recommend it."

reviewText:
I just submitted a request for a refund -- I would not suggest picking this one up, which is a shame because I would love a good JRPG right about now.

Some issues --

1) I have not had issues with FPS dips that others have had, and I don't mind the general graphic quality of the game -- what drove me crazy was how inconsistent the game was visually.  Some character models appear to have been updated for the HD" release
date: but others were not.  Some textures look good
recommended: some look awful.  Some effects appear to have been upgraded (there's some real-time rendered fire in the intro section that is brilliant)
hoursPlayed: and some is god awful.   The constant disparity in quality makes the lower-end sections / characters / textures / effects really stand out
voteText: in a bad way.\n\n2) Too many circa 1999 PC gaming design issues.  Having to exit the game to a launcher to change certain settings (or fix issues
helpfulPercent: like the on-screen prompts changing from controller input to keyboard for whatever reason) should not be a thing in 2015 game from a "AAA" publisher.\n\n3) The controls are just not good.  Keyboard isn't even an option -- unless you like the idea of controlling the camera with the numpad.  I find the controller support baffling -- you can already switch targets with the left and right triggers
votesHelpful: but they made it so you can also switch targets by nudging the right stick.  Why is this an issue?  Early in the game
votesTotal: I was on a bridge with ranged targets attacking me from up high on buildings / ledges up and across gaps.  I switched to a ranged character and tried to turn the camera to survey how many enemies there were.  Unfortunately
votesFunny: the camera was zoomed in to the point I could hardly see anything.  Every time I tried to move the camera
commentsCount: the game interpreted it as a target lock change.  The result?  The camera was just spinning circles around my character
column16:
and with the god-awful motion blur I couldn't see a damned thing.

4) The early combat was very button-mashy.  I couldn't tolerate the game long enough to see if this changes.

5) The game is tonally strange.  The game opens up with more blood and combat-honesty than I can recall having ever seen in an FF game -- and brings in your RAH RAH GOOOOOO HIGH SCHOOL SUPER POWER SQUAD heroes.  The gravitas from the opening is quickly lost.

6) The voice acting was not terrible
column17: but the voice SYNC was horrid.  Spoken lines were frequently off from lip flaps by at least 0.5 seconds.  Bat voice-to-animation syncing drives me crazy
column18: don't know why.  This may not be an issue for others
column19: but it's bothersome for me.\n\nI really
column20: really wanted to like this game -- I had some hope after getting a chance to play the Episode Duscae demo for FF XV on PS4
column21: and was readily impressed.  I've been in the mood for a good JRPG
column22: but this was definitely not it.  Hopefully Tales of Zesteria will fill that void."

reviewText:
*UPDATE BEFORE YOU READ*
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Wow, I'm looking at the 7 out of 16 people who found my review helpful and honestly, I think totalbiscuit is right. People are really starting to accept mediocrity more and more. Listen I don't know if people felt my not recommended rating was unhelpful because of my 30fps lock complaint or the fact that they disagreed with me saying that I had no problems with the port, but either way I have no idea why anyone would find the review unhelpful. I'd like some honest opinions in the comment section if that's not too much to ask. I honestly want to know what poeple are disagreeing on here.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I think the most disapointing aspect of this game is the 30 fps lock. It's what made me ask for a refund and really regret my purchase. Anyone who is willing to overlook the 30 fps is lock needs to open their eyes. If 30 fps isn't acceptable for Arkham Knight or Dark Souls then this shouldn't be either. Especially in 2015. There was literally no reason why this game needed a cap and I think the game would have overall been more enjoyable without this crutch. That and I really hate playing any game under 60fps which is why I play more PC games then ever nowadays.

Other than that I don't know why people are so angry about other aspects of this port.

Although I only played a good hour or so into the game, if that, I can say without a shadow of a doubt everything in this port was pretty well done. The port had a small, yet fair amount of options including the amazing feature to take motion blur out which the PS4 and XBone versions were lacking. I know that if you have a powerful enough PC you can usually run even the worst ports really well, and I guess mine does, because there wasn't a moment where there were framedrops of any sort and no technical issues to be found.

I think that if they remove this ridiculous FPS lock, I'll be more than willing to pick this game up again since I really enjoyed my 10 or so hours with the PS4 version that I had to put down because of time constraints. I think that the game is a pretty decent port and I believe that this is, at the very least, is a step in the right direction for Square Enix in the PC bussiness since Final Fantasy XIII and XIII-2 were abysmal ports. This game shows that Square is willing to optimize their games better and I appreciate it when a Japanese developer throws the PC crowd a bone once in a while.

I know this came off as more of a rant, but if you read this far thanks!

reviewText:
Only played for a short amount of time so far, but thought I would give a review about this title. I will break it down into the good, and the bad.

Good Points:
- Looks really good. I have seen gameplay of the original, and this HD remake looks so much greater. Unlike most HD remakes, this game seems to have a vast difference.
- Combat is fun. The combat in this game is very action packed and indeed very satisfying.
- Multiple characters to start with and more to come. You start with being able to control one of three characters while the other two act as bots, and you can switch at any time. Also from what I have seen later on, you get more characters to pick and choose from.
- Music is great. Of course this was coming as it is a Final Fantasy game, but my god the music is amazing.
- Game runs really well. I have had no issues what so ever, and the 30 fps cap honestly does not feel bad at all. I could barely notice the difference (maybe it was running at more than 30 and they took away the cap, I didn't bother to check).

Bad Points:
- Only two resolution options. Indeed only two, and one of them is too large for my monitor and the other is a bit small. So I have to end up playing the game with black bars, not to great.
- Cutscenes look terrible. The in-game graphics are great, and the cinematics are amazing, but the in-game cutscenes seem to be really ♥♥♥♥, and I mean really ♥♥♥♥, very odd that the in-game cutscenes look worse than the in-game graphics.
- Controls are very weird and ahrd to get used to. Controls are not too bad, but can be challenging to get used to.

Overall, I really do recommend this game, even at full price, but just be informed that it has issues. This game certainly will not be for everyone, and this certainly is different from other finaly fantasy titles, but I still urge people to purchase this great game.

Rate from me (FF Fans): 7.5 / 10Will play until The End" words shown.

Gameplay: 5/10

date:
they already told us about the main conflict of the story. At least you can show it to your friend that interested with this game. I can't tell much about the story because I'm still on progress to but I knew this is good from the start.

Sound: 10/10
Final Fantasy Soundtrack is the best <3.

Performance: 6/10
Two types of resolution 1920x1080 and 1280x720 =(
I pick 1280x720 and it still run smoothly. This is 30 FPS lock but it is ok because it is remaster from PSP Game.
I didn't lag while play this game and the cutscene + sound sync nicely but sometimes the sound on cutscenes stutter.

Helpful TipsLag? Turn Vertical Sync off from your graphic card control panel.

Crash?
1. Open: #:\Steam\SteamApps\common\FINAL FANTASY TYPE-0 HD\_CommonRedist
Install all of them (run .exe application inside folder)
2. Set up your graphics card control panel (ex. Nvidia) to not interfere with the game. If you use NVIDIA
recommended: try to change the "Virtual Reality pre-rendered frames" from "1" to "Use the 3D Application Setting"."

reviewText:
First Impression Review
I review this as a FF fan who never played this game before.

As a Reminder: I will not talk about bad ports and graphic things such as FPS or Resolution. I know it's bad but I don't care and it's still running fine for me. So If you are the one that struggle everytime you see a number below 60, please ignore this review.

Pros    Action RPG gameplay similar with Crisis Core FFVII and it's fun (for me).
Great music and BGM
Not a straight gameplay like FFXIII, there are another things to do beside the main quests
Good plot
First time in the history that you'll see so a lot of  blood in this series.
Cons    Chat scene sometimes long and boring, it's just a character talking 1-2 sentences and switch to another one.
Even there is a good plot, but they are very bad as storyteller. It may confuse anyone who havn't played FFXIII before. For Example, they talked about l'Cie and didn't explain what is it. (As I've played for now).
Bad camera
Keyboard control suck (unless you use controller like me which is good)
In conclusion, I still give this thumb up. It's a good game but not great enough to be the top-tier of the series.

reviewText:
This game is an experimental FF, where you control a team of 14, three at a time.  Each one plays differently and you can freely swap between them.

I platinum'd this on PS4 and enjoyed it immensely.  The story is dark and poignant, the music is incredible, and the cinematics might be some of the most intense in all of Final Fantasy (rivaling FFIX).  Whatever obtuse things you might find with the gameplay are because it's a port of a PSP game, but even despite that it's very addicting.

For people willing to take a risk and try something different it's definitely worth it.  Just don't go in expecting a standard JRPG, this is a weird mix of action-RPG interspersed with real-time strategy missions.  This is one of the more interesting takes on Final Fantasy that Square has done in quite a while, and might hold you over until FF15.

Use a controller, don't try to KB&M this.

reviewText:
This game is one of the best Final Fantasy games in a long time (the three FF13 games were boring hallways with annoying characters and a dull story).  I have not had any issues playing this game.  The people complaining about technical stuff are forgetting that it is an old PSP port.  If any of them had played the fan translation on an emulator, they would see a huge difference.  Controls work great on controller because that is what it was designed for.  Camera is much better now than it was with the emulation because you can actually use the right joystick to control it.

I'm convinced that people are just never happy with anything no matter what anyone does and they feel like they have to nitpick everything.  We're lucky Square Enix even brought the game over at all since it wasn't originally released in the US.

All in all the game is great and it runs great despite all the complainers.  Here's hoping the rating will eventually reflect what the game really deserves.

Pros

+Great combat (so much better than FF13)
+Great story and mature setting
+Great music and sound (as should be expected from a Final Fantasy game)
+Vastly improved camera controls from the original PSP version
+14 unique playable characters
+Unnoticeable 30 fps despite people complaining (I've had zero noticeable graphic errors)
+Replayability

Kind of cons (with explanations)

-Limited free time between missions (but can be considered good because it makes sure the story keeps moving)
-Less detail on some characters (not a problem for me but others might not like it)
-Characters don't gain any exp when not participating in battle (makes you use new characters which is nice at times)
-Practically requires a controller (however I planned on using one anyway)
- They killed the chocobo at the beginning :'(

reviewText:
Gosh. Where to begin.

The game is great. I'm happy that they imported the game onto steam since it's really been a while since I played this game but from the get go, the controls without a controller is just difficult. The keyboard really isn't meant to be used for this game. Don't get me wrong, it's possible to still play the game with the keyboard. (Even on FFXIII and FFXIII-2 , I was still able to play the entire game with the keyboard thanks to the fact that there was alot less buttons being pushed.) However, you will have difficult time doing anything in the game.

The gameplay seems smoother than the original and I'm not sure how it is for the ps4 since I have yet to play it on it. Feels like the gameplay is alot less glitchy and overall, i really don't have any issues.

Sound is fine. Doesn't seem like the import affected the sound at all.

The funniest part is the graphics. When they say HD, they mean adding a few pixels here and little bit more pixels over there and maybe add some more clarity far over there. Well....... I think you know where I'm going with this.
The graphics really feel like a rushed job and was slightly disappointed with how it turned out. I honestly would have waited longer if they were willing to do a better job on making the game actually HD. But sadly, it didn't happen.

Overall verdict is a decent game that feels rushed. Honestly, alot of people would have waited just to have the game become actually HD. Fans and non-Fans complains were all the same: graphics and controls. A delay on the game for a better one would have not hurt the company but actually improve sales but then again, i'm not part of their marketing team or development so what would I know.

If you are a FF fan, buy the game. I'm sure you you already have the original one and are just playing the game again. If you are not a FF fan, I'll leave the decision up to you. I recommend buying it, as long as you don't mind poorly importing supposed HD" graphics that comes with the game.

IMPORTANT NOTE: you need a decent computer for this game. Will not run on old computers. <--- I have 2 computers and on one of them
date: the game doesn't run that smoothly.\n\n"

reviewText:
Tl;Dr - Game runs fine, most people just whining about 30fps lock or having to use a controller when its no big issue. Worth getting.

So even though I don't often make reviews, the negative reviews are irritating me far too much to not do one for this.

Lets talk 30fps first, is it a problem? No. Would it have been nice uncapped? Sure, but a lot of games these days are still 30 cappedand were still making the transition to 60/uncapped in general, right now 60+fps is still a luxury, not a requirement.

There are some people even giving negative reviews because fullscreen doesn't work. Is that fair? No, because only a very minor player-base is having said issue, myself, as with most others haven't had this issue, so for giving it a negative review for your rigs issue, not exactly fair.

Controls, people are complaining about the keyboard controls being ♥♥♥♥. I wouldn't know, I use a controller. But thats my point, very few JRPGS are meant for keyboards, and my god I hope they never do, at the end of the day most people who primarily use PC's for gaming should have a gamepad of somesorts now and if you dont, dont blame the devs, its a game ported from PSP - PS4 - PC, go figure its more confortable on a controller. A lot of games are, its still mainly first person games that are best for keyboards.

Now, away from my response to complaints, the game itself? Awesome, while yes the 'HD Remaster side' a lot of the time seems lazy and rushed (as seen in a lot of the ingame cutscenes) for the most part, its a nice improvement where it works.

As with any Final Fantasy, good or bad, the music is absolutely gorgeous and in my opinion one of the best soundtracks to date.

My only main gripe with the game is its camera. Oh god the camera, its aweful. While in combat locking onto targets you often find the camera surging around from target to target or the camera being stuck behind scenery where its trying to focus on a target, forcing you to briefly turn off the lock on and reset it.

The combat itself can be a little off at times, but it mainly comes down to which character you use, Ace for example (the games main protagonist) is probably one of the more boring characters, using cards as his weapon empowered with magic, you find youself just standing in one spot throwing them making you feel rooted and bland. Where as other characters such as the dragoon, nine, feels a lot more mobile and heavy.

The story right off the bat, the very first cut-scene, is intense, though depressing it certainly brings you into this new world hard and fast, which is exactly what this game is. While having a main and intruging main story the game also offers a lot of side story/lore/quests, a lot of which require a certain character from class-0 to see, making you really bond and enjoy each character seperately.

All in all, most of the 'issues' seem to be personal gripes or issues with a few rigs, which 90% of big name games have upon first release, is this an exception? Of course not, but these issues seem to be minimal and personal.

Do I recommend? Hell yes, one of the best Final Fantasys to own on PC right now.

reviewText:
First Impression:

Not going to lie, I got this game mostly for the Dota items.

I haven't played a FF game since FFX. The biggest reason for that is because I don't care for where the character design and story elements are going these days in FF games.

So, far it is honestly fun but the battle system confused the hell out of me because the tutorial was referencing keyboard bindings when I was playing on a 360 controller. The second time I loaded the game, I was able to change my input to controller at the launch menu. It wasn't recognized the first time so if you're having this issue, try re-launching the game.

I'm enjoying the darker themed story and it is definitely a lot grittier than previous FF games I've played. This alone is enough to get my attention at least and give it a go.

It's a PSP port, not much of a remake so don't expect mind blowing graphics. Other people have noted that it only played in windowed mode (not true for me) and that the resolution is limited to two options (one of them being 1920x1080, which works out fine for me). With a game like this it comes down to gameplay, which seems good enough to warrant  a purchase at this point. If you're unsure, than just pick it up next steam sale.

reviewText:
The intro is actually pretty hardcore and messed up. Bad dudes straight up massacring people, sticking them with bayonets while they're defenseless lying on the ground. There's even some blood. Don't remember any other Final Fantasy being quite like this, quite this brutal.
This is totally the most viscreal FF I've seen, even this Chocobo is covered in blood and seeping wounds. Hearing the scream of your comrades right after the gristly sound of them being sliced open is perhaps new for a FF. It's actually pretty awesome, I can feel something. I'm much more empathetic to what's going on now that it feels a bit more real and gritty.

Combat is fun enough and you start off with 14 different squad" members to choose from. Controls fine with a gamepad but the camera with lock-on can go real crazy but it's stuff you can manage without a lot of hassle. The story is shaping up to be interesting enough
date: even if there are a few too many words and names that mean nothing to me resulting in a troubled understanding of who's attacking who and so on.\n\nThe graphics look fine the majority of the time
recommended: acceptable at least. Game runs at a "smooth" 30 well enough but don't go thinking you can still max everything out even with a beefy PC
hoursPlayed: a couple of graphical options aren't so well optimised."

reviewText:
Thought I would post an initial impression after seeing the large amount of negativity.

I have no bias towards this game.  I wanted to play this mainly because the last time I ever played a FF game was when I was really young (FFVII) and wanted to give the series a shot again.

When I installed and started the game up, I immediately realized it was a port.  I should've known after finding some gameplay of the game on the PSP.  Once you get past this fact and that the full screen will only work with certain resolutions (forcing you to do windowed), the game is fun.

I immediately got sucked into the cinematics.  My friend thought I would not enjoy the cinematics since I generally have a short attention span for these cutscenes, but it was good!

I really did take a leap of faith with this game because it was different from a lot of the games I play ( Western RPGs, FPS, Strategy).  I am really glad I did though because it has been an enjoyment.

Pros:
-Good cinematic
-Diverse characters
-Large variety of abilities
-Fluid action and movement


Cons:
-It's a port
-Can't full screen
-Escape brings up the close game" seen in previous FF ports
date: but with a prompt that lets you close or cancel.  (Friend told me about the disasters of this)\n-Strange targeting system"
helpfulPercent: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Finally the game is out on our beloved computers ! <3

I was about to buy the game on my PS4 when I noticed the preorder on Steam... Can't wait for the preorder bonus we'll get for DOTA 2.

Well, must admit that we are facing some troubles with the game at the beginning (had to change the settings of time and date - add something about the decimal symbol '.' instead of ',' we have in France) but when this problem is solved...the game is kinda FUN. They did a pretty good job in making this HD version of this game which was only available in Japan since 2011. And, as I don't speak Japanese fluently yet (sad, eh), the game was unreachable for me. I didn't expect such a remake of the game on PS4, Xbox One & PC. So : Thank You.

I will recommend this game to those who are patient & curious enough and don't really care about the graphics (Which are totally fine from my point of view !!) and to those who like the Fabula Nova Crystallis saga of Final Fantasy ( FF XIII, XIII-2 / Versus XIII (?) ).

As far as the gameplay is concerned, it is a sort of Crisis Core-type with 14 characters you can play in a very dynamic way. Dynamic character switch, almost instant cast of spells... fast death for those who don't play carefully. The game is challenging and seems to offer a great deal of evolutions all the game long.

Can't wait to continue the game.

Have Fun and enjoy !

reviewText:
The intro is actually pretty hardcore and messed up. Bad dudes straight up massacring people, sticking them with bayonets while they're defenseless lying on the ground. There's even some blood. Don't remember any other Final Fantasy being quite like this, quite this brutal.
This is totally the most viscreal FF I've seen, even this Chocobo is covered in blood and seeping wounds. Hearing the scream of your comrades right after the gristly sound of them being sliced open is perhaps new for a FF. It's actually pretty awesome, I can feel something. I'm much more empathetic to what's going on now that it feels a bit more real and gritty.

Combat is fun enough and you start off with 14 different squad" members to choose from. Controls fine with a gamepad but the camera with lock-on can go real crazy but it's stuff you can manage without a lot of hassle. The story is shaping up to be interesting enough
date: even if there are a few too many words and names that mean nothing to me resulting in a troubled understanding of who's attacking who and so on.\n\nThe graphics look fine the majority of the time
recommended: acceptable at least. Game runs at a "smooth" 30 well enough but don't go thinking you can still max everything out even with a beefy PC
hoursPlayed: a couple of graphical options aren't so well optimised."
voteText: August 19, 2015

reviewText:
First an advise to You: Play it with a Controller!

Well, I'm playing now 7,6h and I'm still at the first Area of the Game and completed the 2nd Mission (because I love it to Grind a bit on the World Map and explore things:) ).
So I will Update this Review again when I'm more into the Game itself.
Here my Pros and Cons:

Pros:
Wide variety of Characters to play from the beginning (14), and almost everyone has an unique playstile (Guns, Spear, Scythe, Flute, Cards, .... )
Normal-Mode is perfect for people who played Action-Roleplaying games
Hard-Mode is REALLY Hard! (enemies get a +30 lvl Buff)
Finally a Final Fantasy with a World Map with Dungeons and Bosses in it!
Interesting Combat-System (attacking enemies with a variety of moves and avoiding attacks (many attacks against you hit hard)
Sometimes You can stay in the Combat-Area and even harder enemies will spawn if you do so
Training-Mode (You can practice one Character in the Arena against an infinite amount of enemies)
Awesome Soundtrack!

(...) <need more playtime and Update will follow>
Cons:
The Story isn't really my type (but as I said, I'm still at the first Area, so maybe it will be a great unique Story for me)
Due to the Critical- and Deadly-blows You can perform on an enemy, some of them aren't really challenging (If You know when You can strike them for a deadly blow)

(...) <need more playtime and Update will follow>
Things I don't mind:
The graphics. For the people crying: It's a PsP port to the PC with a HD-Improvement. But this doesn't mean a complete rework of the textures, effects, etc. There is now an option in the launcher to improve the quality.
FPS Lock. Many people complain about the FPS-Lock in FF-T0 HD. Well, this lock is at 30FPS. Under 25FPS you would see the game stuttering. So it isn't.
People complaining about the Playstile. OMG we want a turn-based game like VII
recommended:
..." and so on. My personal opinion to this: I am a fan of the turn-based RPG. But this game is excellent too with the Action-Roleplay style. It would be really boring if every Final Fantasy has the same playstile! So be grateful to play such an awesome Game.

(...) <need more playtime and Update will follow>
You still don't know if You want to buy this game? Look for some Gameplay-Footage on YouTube or Gaming-Websites and read the reviews there from people who actually know what good games are and what not! :) ."

reviewText:
Ugh, where to start...

Graphics.  The graphics would be top notch, had this been a PS2 game.  The videos are the worst.  For something toting to be 'HD', they definitely missed their mark.

Acting.  I've never played a voiced FF game where the VAs sounded so...robotic.  There's no REAL emotion in them, they just sound like they're reading from a script in as minimalist a way as they can just to get it done.

Cutscenes/conversations.  One word: Clunky.  A lot of the conversations look like visual novels in a way...the people stand and/or move in certain positions/ways, and it continues to loop until you move onto the next part.  As well, Someone will be talking to one person, then the very next chat box pops up, and that person has been replaced with another person in the exact same spot.  In general, the movements of people within cutscenes and conversations is just as robotic, if not more, than the voice acting.

Combat.  The combat is clunky as hell.  There is absolutely no fluidity to how anything functions in combat.  As well, several times I found myself stuck in a case where an enemy would knock me down, and before I could get back up, they would knock me down again.  This would continue until either the unit models got far enough apart, or someone else interrupted it.  Most of the abilites get you stuck in animation so that you can't cancel it to dodge an incoming attack - once you start the attack, you're basically screwed until the attack is finished.

The characters.  Good lord.  There are, what, 14 playable characters in this game?  WTF?  This isn't a Suikoden game.  They're all thrown at you right from the start.  It's not like a typical game where you are introduced to them one or two at a time until you have the full crew.  You just suddenly get 14 characters all at once to pick and choose between.

Immersion.  Now, I'm not usually one to complain about immersion breaking in a game, but this game is very visceral, very emotional, and while I definitely love that part of it...suddenly moogles.  Like, what the hell.  It'd be like putting Moogles in Mad Max.  It's extremely jarring.  Even the Chocobos have been worked in a way to really fit into the visceral feel of the game.  But not the moogles.

Overall, I just really feel like this was done by some basement-dwelling division of Squenix.  It has absolutely none of the polish and luster that usually comes with a Final Fantasy title.  The voice acting is thrid rate, camera angles are terrible, controls are clunky, graphics are bad.  I just really can't find anything good to say about this game.

I've been an avid Final Fantasy fan since I first played Final Fantasy Legend on the original gameboy.  I have played and completed every FF game created to date, I played FF11 for 5 years, and I currently play FF14.  I played the FF13 trilogy on PS3 and then also bought them on Steam.

reviewText:
10/10 would buy again

Since this game was on the PSP I've wanted to play. I've never owned a console since snes (unless handhelds count then i've own the gbc,gba,nds,n3ds) . My introduction to the final fantasy series was FF8 in 2004. ever since then I've wanted to  just play all the final fantasy. The descision to put all the final fantasy games on to PC has given me so much joys over the past year or so. However, with how FF13 was ported over I was a little bit disappointed since it had so many issues.

It is my pleasure however, to say that I have not experienced any issues with this  FFT-0 HD port. It runs smooth and i have cranked every thing to detailed and high. I'm using windows 10 and have not experienced any issues. Yes it is a shame that it doesn't have 60fps but that's life.


Be prepared for long cinematics and some (for me) time to adjust to the battle system. Also use a contorl for hte bets experience.

Will buy again

reviewText: Played a bit of it and I'm pretty hooked on the story and gameplay. As far as the game goes, I give it a thumbs up. But as far as a port, it still needs work. Graphics look pretty good, given that it's just an HD remake of a PSP game. I wasn't expecting new gen so it works. My biggest problem with the game right now is the camera (which seems to do whatever it wants during combat) and the controls. I figured it'd be best to use a controller so I went with that. The issue is that the tutorial is meant for mouse and keyboard and shows no help for controller. So you'll have to learn it as you go. However, as a game, I'll give it a thumbs up. Definitely worth a buy, if you can get past the camera thing. And it's not the worst port we've seen lately. *cough* Batman *cough*

reviewText:
The port is not as bad as people are saying. I do have some performance problems, but my computer doesn't meet the recommended specs anyway, so I just set to low and it runs smoothly now.
Also the input is not bad. It works perfectly for me using an xbox controller or keyboard.
The only thing that made me mad is that I read all configuration options and set it carefully for my best experience before starting the game and once it launched it was as I never changed anything. Well, I just did it again and it worked, sounds like a day one bug. So far I didn't encounter any other one.
It's exactly the psp game, but with a far better camera control, since I do need a stick to control it instead of pressing buttons.
So if you like a good rpg give it a try. It mixes elements from the classics and the latest FF games. I really missed the mighty Magitek arsenal!

reviewText:
First an advise to You: Play it with a Controller!

Well, I'm playing now 7,6h and I'm still at the first Area of the Game and completed the 2nd Mission (because I love it to Grind a bit on the World Map and explore things:) ).
So I will Update this Review again when I'm more into the Game itself.
Here my Pros and Cons:

Pros:
Wide variety of Characters to play from the beginning (14), and almost everyone has an unique playstile (Guns, Spear, Scythe, Flute, Cards, .... )
Normal-Mode is perfect for people who played Action-Roleplaying games
Hard-Mode is REALLY Hard! (enemies get a +30 lvl Buff)
Finally a Final Fantasy with a World Map with Dungeons and Bosses in it!
Interesting Combat-System (attacking enemies with a variety of moves and avoiding attacks (many attacks against you hit hard)
Sometimes You can stay in the Combat-Area and even harder enemies will spawn if you do so
Training-Mode (You can practice one Character in the Arena against an infinite amount of enemies)
Awesome Soundtrack!

(...) <need more playtime and Update will follow>
Cons:
The Story isn't really my type (but as I said, I'm still at the first Area, so maybe it will be a great unique Story for me)
Due to the Critical- and Deadly-blows You can perform on an enemy, some of them aren't really challenging (If You know when You can strike them for a deadly blow)

(...) <need more playtime and Update will follow>
Things I don't mind:
The graphics. For the people crying: It's a PsP port to the PC with a HD-Improvement. But this doesn't mean a complete rework of the textures, effects, etc. There is now an option in the launcher to improve the quality.
FPS Lock. Many people complain about the FPS-Lock in FF-T0 HD. Well, this lock is at 30FPS. Under 25FPS you would see the game stuttering. So it isn't.
People complaining about the Playstile. OMG we want a turn-based game like VII
recommended:
..." and so on. My personal opinion to this: I am a fan of the turn-based RPG. But this game is excellent too with the Action-Roleplay style. It would be really boring if every Final Fantasy has the same playstile! So be grateful to play such an awesome Game.

(...) <need more playtime and Update will follow>
You still don't know if You want to buy this game? Look for some Gameplay-Footage on YouTube or Gaming-Websites and read the reviews there from people who actually know what good games are and what not! :) ."

reviewText:
I rarely write reviews but I feel I should warn people prior to buying this game. I would like to start with the fact that i am a great fan of the Final fantasy seris and own all the games in the seris. I bought this game becasue i want a rich story rpg. I am looking forward to playing the game.

Looking forward? but you have time on the game..... you say.

Thats right. I have tried to play the game many times now. The problem is simple the controls . If you use the keyboard controls you need one hand over the wasd keys to control movement one hand on the numbpad for the camera movement and then need to press buttons such as backspace to dodge, space to lock on and f to attack. My fingers simply dont controt that way.

Ok says you what about customising the keyboard controls...?

not an option

Ok what about using a controller after all its a game designed for consoles?

I like many people on the game have found that the controllers simply dont connect to the game. Doesnt matter if your using a generic, xbox or ps controller they all seem to have issues.


TLDR: Even a good game is failed by being unplayable.

reviewText:
While the base game mechanics themselves are fine this port is a horrendous and lazy cash grab.

The game is unplayable without a gamepad and requires unnatural and unintuitive keyboard input while failing to use the single thing that would make this playable on pc, mouse look.

Branding this game as HD" is also a vast over exaggeration of the few improvements made over the PSP original. Character models
date: textures and overall visual quality is poor and the entire game ends up looking muddy and smudged."
helpfulPercent: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This... thing (sorry, just try to imagine I was able to find a suitably derogative term) claims to be an RPG. What I played for about an hour was a movie with playable battle scenes. That's the first strike against the game. And really, it is, because for me, Final Fantasy has always been an RPG series - a mostly good series, even. Changing the genre this drastically is a decision I really don't understand. I just hope any future Games aren't like this.

The controls are strange and probably require hours of getting used to them... or being used to a controller instead of a keyboard. I kept entering the menu instead of whatever I was trying to do, for example.

And finally, after an hour of introductory fights where you're basically immortal, the item preventing the death of my team is taken away and I'm thrown into a fight I could only win if I were a bot, a professional gamer or if I dedicated half of my days just to this game, which really isn't realistic.

I really tried to like this game, but since I wanted a Final Fantasy RPG, it's just not possible.

reviewText:
*This is personal opinion from the player who played the *Free-version of the game on PSP.

And once again, I shed tears on the prologue. Worth it all lol.
_ Like people complained, the lack of use of a mouse is... not that much of a burden. But like they said, it should be implemented. It's not that hard... Isn't it ?
_ 30 fps lock ? Not that hard to notice if you are a frequent console or handheld owner. But I do hope they would release a patch to unlock this soon.
_ Graphics ? Hmm, quite impressive if compare to the original PSP version. But not that much if compared to other games with the same price and cost.

So 30$ for this game ? Do you feel Type-0 worths the money ?
For me, the answer will be YES.
Why you asked ?
Because I can play on a 32 inches monitor without fearing losing graphic quality. Because I can finally put my money in this game and feel proud about it. As a fan and as a proper gamer.
Also, If you are a true deep RPG gamer. You will recognize this game for it's quality story and plot setting. War is a sensitive topic. Yet overused too much at times. Type-0 let you see how brutal it is, how sad it is and there is no winner in war. Only victims. Please stop looking at the graphic and forget the point of an RPG: the story.
30 dollars to once more relive the experience of a legend built by twelves teenagers ?
Yes please.  No matter how sad it is :)

reviewText: I'm going to start by saying that the more I play this game, the more I like it. It's very different from many other games, especially FF games I have played in the past, but it is keeping me engaged and I'm used to the mechanics already.\n\nSo on to the technical stuff: This is a game from 2006... from a MOBILE console... from 2006. This was when the game had a preview build put together for E3. It never had the budget or time given to it compared to the other games, so it took them longer to get it to market, and even longer to port it to the PS4, and now to the PC. IF your PC can handle it, the Higher" and "Highest" AA settings in the game affect a lot more than AA
date: which can make the game look very crisp
recommended: which is a lot better than the PS4 version already... if not
hoursPlayed: then the "Normal" mode still delivers a great gaming experience.\n\nO.K.
voteText: now that we have that out of the way

votesHelpful: while really being more of an [early] PS3 game even in it's 'HD' version.\n\nYes

votesFunny: if that is all you want in a game

column20: this is not a full "HD" game
column22: it won't support anything above 1080p and 30fps as of the time of this review. Does it matter? That's entirely up to you.\n\nMy system is an i7 4820k with 32GB of high-frequency RAM
column23: and 2x 3GB 280x Black Edition cards from XFX. The game on my 1440p monitor is pretty much a PS3 game (yes
column25: not PS4) with no stutters or graphic problems... except that it only supports 1 graphics card
column26: and the requirements are low enough that you DON'T need my system to play at the same level as I do.\n\nI have not gotten very far in the game

column28: in that the voice acting is great
column29: and the music with the cut scenes are fairly 'epic'-feeling.\n\nGameplay is solid

column33: but I never much liked using a controller with PC games anyway.\n\nIn short

column39: which is an action RPG with a Final Fantasy vibe... from 2006... you will probably enjoy this game just as much as I have so far.\n\nThe opening cinematic was heart-felt and just about drove me to tears
column40: while the combat and story so far has kept me entertained.\n\nFor me

reviewText:
lets clear some things up because obviously u guys are swaying alot of opinions with your stupidity.

- The game is full controller supported (yes it does show controller commands/ right side please look before u write are review)
- The game is fully playable in full screen (please learn how to set up a game before u write a review)
- Camera controls are just fine (please remind yourself that we got a psp hd remastered game not a full remake before writing you're review)
- Audio is fantastic, no stutter, sound glitches whatsoever. (please dont be writing your reviews on your little budget pc's)
- Mouse cursor is NOT always on screen u can move it off the screen just like any other full-screened game, please learn how to use a computer before writing a review.


Now, if you plan on using mouse and keyboard i feel for you, their isnt many games out their that does well with mouse and keyboard so your gaming options can be pretty limited especially for rpg's (darksouls ptde). Stop telling people u have a high-end pc when your naming your 760 graphics cards, their outdated be honest with yourself. The only problems i see with the game is resolution options for those who have laptops or terrible monitors i feel for you. mouse and keyboard controls dont feel right, if u dont have a xbox controller i feel for you. and the 30 fps lock, lets clear that up 30 fps lock isnt that bad especially since were talking psp. JUST BECAUSE ITS LOCKED DOES NOT MEAN ITS NOT SMOOTH. this game albeit running at 30 fps still runs smoothly. at any rate im gonna go kick some ♥♥♥.

reviewText:
<INITIAL IMPRESSIONS AFTER STOPPING PLAY EARLY TO PREVENT BRAINING MYSELF WITH A SHOVEL>

I'm a SquEnix fanboy, but this game is garbage.

Pros:
* There's actually PC-ish options now. A whooooooole lot of them.
* Glorious 30 FPS pisses off dumbasses.
* JP audio option
* Cinematics can be skipped.
* Playing as Odin was okay once I got used to the controls.

Cons:
* But playing as frail children against the same boss that takes Odin a couple minutes to beat is not fun at all, especially when its only attack stunlocks and demolishes them easily. Especially the guy with near-zero move speed that just gets nuked instantly and there's nothing you can do about it.

* There's no option to exit the game on the title screen. HAVING A WAY TO QUIT IS NOT OPTIONAL. THIS IS AN ELEMENTARY DESIGN RULE.

* OVERWHELMING number of cinematics and cut scenes. I mean seriously. It's a cut scene leading into the cut scene that leads to the next cut scene. I really get the feeling that having to implement gameplay was a real downer for these people because it interrupts their cut scenes.

* Writing is complete ♥♥♥♥. I mean the plot so far is dull but looks like it may end up with some interesting parts (crystal users vs l'Cie), but the actual writing is complete garbage. In one of the several opening cut scenes this guy spent like 20 minutes giving his death speech, going on about his beloved senpai and chocobo buddy... ALL AFTER IT WAS DECLARED TOO LATE TO CURE HIM WITH MAGIC. I found myself sitting here screaming, DIE MOTHER ♥♥♥♥ER! DIE!"

It's like they hired a crack team of researchers to dig up every lame misstep that Final Fantasy has made over the years and then they dumped it all in a bucket
date: put it in a paint mixer and then barfed it out onto a UMD.\n\nThat's the original game
recommended: and this port isn't doing it any favors.\n\nThere's a launcher too
hoursPlayed: which sucks ♥♥♥ (I know it's popular. That just makes it suck more ♥♥♥.) but fortunately it can be used with the controller

helpfulPercent: even though you're obviously using the controller.\n\nAnyway
votesHelpful: don't pay money for this. Even if you're an FF lover

reviewText:
FIRST AND FOREMOST
At the moment (release date) this port has some flaws. Some of them, like 30 FPS cap, won't be fixed. Others, like audio lags and launching crashes, will be adressed soon. Be patience, god dammit. As for the low graphics quality, what else did you expect from the PSP port?

The game itself is amazing. 5 hours in, and I am only starting to find all the things I can perform and achieve, just like in other FF games. Reminds me a little bit of Valkyria Chronicles, witch is great. Story doesn't seem much interesting and captivating so far, though. It is mostly a mess. However, gameplay is top tier. Don't judge the game by the crapload of negative reviews from those who didn't get their DOTA2 courier the second the game was out. Great experience for every FF fan and not only them.

reviewText:
My view on gaming is not on Graphic, but on gameplay and fun. Because, in my experience, after playing for an hour, you do not notice the graphic any longer. Despite being locked on 30 fps, the gameplay feels responsive. This game is able to hold a steady fps rate, that makes it superior in all counts to the FF XIII ports.

The gameplay is action based and in realtime. Allthough it is easy, even for people with difficulties in these genre, like myself. The game itself is fun an addictive, that is a good sign. Because this is, in my oppinion, the most important thing you can say about a game.

The graphics, even toned down, because of my older PC, are sufficient for a JRPG in my oppinion

AMD Phenon II X50 3.1 Ghz, 3 Cores, 6 GB RAM, Nvidia GT 650

There is a lack of options in the resolution department, and I am missing the 1650:1050 resolution. The workaround for that, is, to select the 1080p resolultion, play it in windows mode, and use a programm, that sets the windows mode to borderless mode -> http://westechsolutions.net/sites/WindowedBorderlessGaming/ This has to be patched, because this is unacceptable in this day and age.

Another negative point is the camera view in bossfights with big monsters. It's awful, because you are sometimes only able to see a part of it, and don't really now where you are aiming, and what are you doing. This needs definitly to be patched. In a manner, that you can see at least the whole boss all the time.

But despite these flaws I recommend these game, because I won't give it back. Wait for a sale, or at least for some patches.

reviewText:
[Day 1 Review]
To sum this game up.
Decent game, horrible port.
I have never ever written a negative review for any game out of 524 games. Well theres a first for anything.

Lets talk about the game's pros and cons

1. As with most final fantasy stories, the story is pretty good and has alot of depth.
2. Gameplay handles pretty well, if you have a controller. If you dont? Well lets just say I gave up trying to use my kb/m and swapped to a controller
3. A plus for some, a minus for me. Too many characters to train. And from just about every guide I read its advised to level ALL 14 characters. This might belong to JRPGs but thats too overwhelming for my liking.
4. The game has a system where you are allowed serval actions per day. It is completely impossible to clear everything on your first playthrough. Or even second for that matter.
5. Something seems off about the audio sync on cut scenes.

Now... lets talk about the port. As wtih most square enix ports, the port is horrible
1. Completely no mouse control. You move the camera with numpad. I have a somewhat stubborn streak and generally refuse to use controllers for PC games. I gave up after trying for around 10 mins and begrudginly connected a controller.
2. No option anywhere to quit game, you press esc and game will alt tab and prompt you.
3. Theres only 2 screen resolutions.
4. No option to keybind stuff. They just give you two sets of keys and expect you to deal with it.
5. Game capped at 30 FPS [Not really a problem for me]

So do I recommend this?
Offer? maybe
Full price? Hell no
